Rebates and assistance

energy-theme-green

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Annual electricity concession

Annual electricity concession

Program:

Annual electricity concession

Location:

Vic

A concession on domestic mains electricity usage and service costs is available to eligible card holders. The concession is available year-round.

The concession amounts to 17.5% of electricity usage and service cost, and is calculated after retailer discounts and solar credits have been deducted.

Households with very high electricity bills (over $2,890.45 in the year, starting 1 December 2018) need to apply for the Excess electricity concession to continue to receive a concession on their bill.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the concession, the electricity account holder must have one of the following:

  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • Health Care Card
  • Veterans’ Affairs Gold Card.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Annual electricity concession

Email: concessions@health.vic.gov.au

Phone: 1800 658 521

Annual electricity concession for eligible card holders

Program:

Annual electricity concession

Location:

Tas

The annual electricity concession provides a daily discount to eligible Tasmanian customers as a cents per day rate.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the concession, you must hold one of the following:

  • Services Australia or DVA Pensioner Concession Card
  • Services Australia Health Care Card
  • ImmiCard (Bridging Visa E).

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Tasmanian Government

Website: Annual electricity concession - Tasmania

Email: concessions@dpac.tas.gov.au

Phone: 1300 135 513

  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Appliance purchase loan assistance

Appliance purchase loan assistance

Program:

No Interest Loans Scheme (NILS)

Location:

ACT
NSW
NT
Qld
SA
Tas
Vic
WA

The No Interest Loans Scheme (NILS) offers individuals and families on low incomes access to safe, fair and affordable loans for purchasing appliances and some other essential household expenses.

NILS is offered by more than 175 local community organisations in over 600 locations across Australia. To find your nearest loan provider go to the NILS website.

The NILS scheme offers loans of up to $1500 for essential goods and services including:

  • fridges and freezers
  • furniture
  • washing machines and dryers
  • stoves
  • heaters
  • TVs
  • computers, laptops and tablets
  • text books
  • car-related expenses
  • some medical and dental services
  • some other items as requested.

Eligibility 

To be eligible for NILS you must:

  • have a health care card/pension card or earn less than $45,000 a year after tax, $60,000 after tax for joint applicants or people with children
  • have lived in your current residence for a minimum of 3 months
  • show a willingness and capacity to repay the loan.

A NILS loan is not a payday loan or a bank loan and cannot be used for cash, bond, rent arrears, debt consolidation, holidays or bills.

There are no credit checks, fees, interest or charges. Repayments are set at an affordable amount over 12 to 18 months.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Good Shepherd Australia New Zealand

Website: No Interest Loan Scheme (NILS)

Phone: 13 64 57

  1. Home

  3. Australasian recycling label

Australasian recycling label

Program:

Australasian Recycling Label

Location:

ACT
NSW
NT
Qld
SA
Tas
Vic
WA

The Australasian Recycling Label (ARL) provides Australians with easy-to-understand recycling information when you need it most. It makes it easier for you to put the right packaging in the right bin. It removes confusion, saves time and reduces waste going to landfill. 

You can find it on the packaging of the things that you buy at the supermarket and other participating stores. It has easy-to-understand instructions about how to correctly dispose of every part of a product’s packaging.

Unlike other labels, the ARL is an evidence-based system underpinned by the Packaging Recyclability Evaluation Portal (PREP). As not all packaging is created equal, not all recycling labels should be the same. It is not possible for a piece of packaging to have the ARL without a PREP assessment that backs up disposal claims.

Contact

Administered by: Planet Ark

Website: Australasian Recycling Label

Email: enquiries@planetark.org

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Battery installation discount

Battery installation discount

Program:

Smart Distributed Batteries Project

Location:

NSW

The Smart Distributed Batteries (SDB) project, with funding from the NSW Government, will develop a 6 MW virtual power plant (VPP) to strengthen the NSW electricity network and reduce electricity costs.

SolarHub is offering a discount to approximately 650 residential and small business customers to encourage battery installation. Customers will be required to join the VPP to receive the discount.

The discount is based on the sustained output of the inverter/battery system. For example, a 10 kWh battery exporting up to 5 kW would be eligible for a $4950 discount.

The SDB project, covering the NSW south coast and NSW councils surrounding the ACT, will likely provide batteries to homes affected by the bushfires. For an additional cost, customers will be given back-up power in the event of bushfires and blackouts.

Benefits

The SDB project helps participants to:

  • reduce energy bills with paid contributions each time their battery is discharged to support the NSW electricity grid
  • store extra energy for use when needed
  • integrate more renewable energy into the grid and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

Eligibility

The SDB project is being deployed in the following Council areas:

  • Shoalhaven City Council
  • Eurobodalla Shire Council
  • Bega Valley Shire Council
  • Queanbeyan-Palerang Regional Council
  • Yass Valley Council (within 100 km of Canberra CBD)
  • Snowy Monaro Council (within 100 km of Canberra CBD)

If you own a home or a business in one of those regions, you are eligible for the SDB discount. 

Contact

Administered by: SolarHub

Website: Smart Distributed Batteries Project

  3. Broadacre farm water audit

Broadacre farm water audit

Program:

Farm Water Supply Planning Scheme

Location:

WA

The Farm Water Supply Planning Scheme provides a rebate to commercial broadacre farmers to fund an audit of their water supply.

A farm water auditor will make a site inspection to help farmers develop a water supply plan which will identify ways to improve the sustainability of their on-farm water supplies.

Eligibility

To be eligible to participate in the program, your broadacre farm must be operating in Western Australia

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Government of Western Australia

Website: Farm Water Supply Planning Scheme

Email: ruralwater@dwer.wa.gov.au

Phone: 1800 780 300

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Building energy efficiency incentive

Building energy efficiency incentive

Program:

Energy Savings Scheme

Location:

NSW

The Energy Savings Scheme can assist eligible NSW businesses with incentives to reduce energy use in office buildings. The incentives are available for office buildings that expect to get a NABERS energy rating of:

  • at least 0.5 star higher than that of average office building stock, or
  • at least 1 star higher than the building’s historical NABERS energy rating

Incentives are site specific and depend on the size of your building and your NABERS star rating.

You should contact an approved supplier well before you begin an upgrade project. The supplier will explain the process and assist with the incentive.

Benefits

Businesses can:

  • reduce energy use and energy bills
  • increase market value and rental income
  • reduce vacancy rates
  • reduce environmental impact.

Eligibility

To be eligible for assistance, your building must:

  • must be located in NSW
  • use an approved supplier.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Energy Savings Scheme

  3. Building finance for environmental upgrades

Building finance for environmental upgrades

Program:

Environmental Upgrade Finance

Location:

Vic

The Victorian Environmental Upgrade Finance offers a free finance facilitation service to businesses, property owners, tenants, councils and community groups. This assists those investing in energy efficiency upgrades, renewables, water and waste efficiency improvements. Entities can be assisted with Environmental Upgrade Finance (EUF).

Benefits

Financial

Financial benefits for businesses may include:

  • zero upfront capital and no additional security requirements
  • competitive interest rates fixed for up to 10 years or more, with reduced re-financing risk
  • improved cash flow, with lower annual repayments offset by energy cost savings
  • option to share costs, delivering a better asset for the owner
  • lower costs.

Environmental

Environmental benefits for businesses may include:

  • savings in energy, water and waste costs
  • reductions in energy, water and waste use
  • reduced greenhouse gas emissions
  • improved working environment for tenant.

Eligibility

To be eligible for an EUF, you must be living within a participating council municipality. Check the map of participating councils.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Environmental Upgrade Finance

Email: sustainablefinance@sustainability.vic.gov.au

Phone: 03 8626 8781

Bundled equipment upgrade incentives

Program:

Energy Savings Scheme

Location:

NSW

The Energy Savings Scheme can assist eligible NSW businesses with multi-equipment types bundle incentives.

A bundled upgrade includes:

  • heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) systems
  • lighting
  • furnaces
  • compressed air systems
  • hot water and steam systems
  • other equipment types.

You should contact an approved supplier well before you begin an upgrade project. The supplier will explain the process and assist with the incentive.

You may need to measure your equipment’s energy use for some time before and after the upgrade. This can be done by sub-metering or checking your energy bills.    

Eligibility

To be eligible for assistance, your business must:

  • be located in NSW
  • use an approved supplier.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Energy Savings Scheme

Program:

Water Use Health Check

Location:

NT

The Water Use Health Check helps businesses, government operations and not-for-profit organisations in the Darwin region to reduce water use and bills by assessing how efficiently they use water.

To be eligible for the Water Use Health Check you must:

  • be a business, government operation or a not-for-profit organisation.

Other conditions may apply.

  3. Business efficiency assistance

Business efficiency assistance

Program:

Smarter Business Solutions Program

Location:

NT

The Northern Territory Smarter Business Solutions Program program assists Indigenous enterprises, businesses and not-for-profit organisations reduce day-to-day energy, water, waste and material costs.

The Smarter Business Solutions program offers different types of support including:

  • advice on current efficient technologies and practices
  • a walk-through site survey to identify potential savings opportunities
  • grants to encourage and support cost savings or initiatives:
    • up to 50% of the cost for efficiency improvements - maximum of $20,000
    • up to 20% for the installation of off-grid renewable energy systems - maximum of $20,000
    • up to 10% for the installation of on-grid renewable energy systems - maximum of $10,000*

*On-grid means 'connected to' or 'availability of' an electricity network.

Eligibility

To be eligible for this rebate, your organisation must be an Indigenous enterprise, an NT business or a not-for-profit organisation and meet the following criteria:

  • be physically located and actively trading in the NT for 12 months with an ABN and remitting GST
  • have an annual turnover between $75,000 and $20 million
  • not be on a domestic tariff if connected to an electricity grid
  • have less than 200 employees
  • have not received equivalent funding from a previous similar support program
  • agree to participate in a follow-up evaluation survey including a savings assessment
  • accept the terms of the Buy Local Plan as identified in the agreement section of the application.

If you are a franchise or multinational business you should speak to a small business champion before you apply.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Northern Territory Government

Website: Smarter Business Solutions Program

Phone: (08) 8999 5479

Business energy and water-efficiency

Program:

Business Energy and Water Program

Location:

ACT

The ACT Government's Business Energy and Water Program offers eligible ACT businesses rebates to upgrade to more water-efficient and energy-efficient technologies. Rebates up to $5000 on a 50/50 co-contribution are available.

Energy and water efficient technologies include:

  • lighting
  • appliances
  • heating or cooling
  • refrigeration
  • insulation
  • toilets and tapware.

Benefits

Benefits to businesses include:

  • lower operating costs by reducing water and energy consumption
  • lower greenhouse gas emissions
  • a free onsite energy and water assessment
  • a tailored action plan.

Eligibility

To qualify for rebates of up to $5000 businesses need to:

  • be operating in the ACT
  • have electricity bills of up to $25,000 per year and/or
  • employ a maximum of 20 staff.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: ACT Government

Website: Business Energy and Water Program

Email: businessenergy@act.gov.au

Phone: 13 22 81

Business energy efficiency incentive

Program:

Victorian Energy Upgrades

Location:

Vic

The Victorian Energy Upgrades program helps businesses save energy and money with a range of discounts and special offers on selected energy-saving products and services.

Discounts and special offers are only available from accredited providers as detailed on the Victorian Energy Upgrade products' pages.

The program can help you with the cost of purchasing:

  • energy-efficient lighting
  • energy-efficient hot water system upgrades
  • energy-efficient heating, ventilation and air conditioning
  • energy and water-saving fixtures and fittings
  • commercial appliances including refrigerated display cabinets
  • refrigeration fans
  • motors
  • energy-efficient fridges and freezers, including disposal of old pre-1996 models
  • energy-efficient TVs
  • energy-efficient clothes dryers
  • energy saving products 
  • customs upgrades

Eligibility

To be eligible for assistance, you must:

  • have a business located in Victoria
  • purchase specified energy-saving products and services from participating businesses
  • have the appliance or product professionally installed where required
  • complete the relevant paperwork at the time of purchase

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Victorian Energy Upgrades

Phone: 136 186

if you have a hearing or speech impairment, call 133 677 (National Relay Service) or visit www.relayservice.com.au.

  3. Business energy-efficient lighting upgrades NSW

Business energy-efficient lighting upgrades NSW

Program:

Lighting upgrades for businesses

Location:

NSW

Replacing old lights with energy efficient lights such as LEDs can help your business reduce energy usage and save you money while helping the environment.

You can also save money by accessing incentives available under the NSW Government Energy Savings Scheme (ESS). Find an approved supplier in your region below.

A lighting upgrade involves switching from inefficient lights, such as fluorescent fixtures and halogen lamps, to new, energy efficient lights, such as LEDs.

Lights like LEDs last much longer than traditional bulbs. Reducing bulb replacement also means lower maintenance costs.

The more energy you save, the greater the incentive you can receive.

Benefits

  • reduce your energy use
  • lower your electricity bills
  • reduce your carbon footprint.

Eligibility

You can check your eligibility and access the financial incentives by contacting an approved supplier in your region. Get the best offer by contacting multiple suppliers.

The supplier will:

  • assess your lighting needs either by phone or by visiting you
  • send a licensed electrician to install the new lights
  • let you know about the minimum amount of lighting needed to qualify for the upgrade.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Lighting upgrades for business

  3. Business recycling equipment rebate

Business recycling equipment rebate

Program:

Bin Trim Rebates

Location:

NSW

The Bin Trim Rebates program assists eligible NSW businesses (including facility managers and recyclers) with rebates of between $1000 and $50,000 covering up to 50% of the cost of buying recycling equipment. 

Equipment includes:

  • balers 
  • compactors
  • glass crushing machines
  • commercial worm farms
  • composters
  • shredders
  • expanded polystyrene (EPS) compaction equipment
  • recycling bins and bin equipment
  • public place recycling bins if the material is collected under a commercial and industrial contract
  • other (check with your assessor).

You will need to contact a Bin Trim assessor to get a free waste assessment. The Bin Trim assessor can determine whether your business is eligible for a rebate based on the contents of your waste bin.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the program your business must:

  • operate in NSW
  • be small to medium-sized and have less than 400 full-time employees
  • be the user of the equipment (except in the case of recyclers)
  • agree to an independent audit to verify ongoing performance.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Bin Trim Rebates

Email: Bintrim.rebates@epa.nsw.gov.au

Compressed air system upgrade incentives

Program:

Energy Savings Scheme

Location:

NSW

The Energy Savings Scheme can assist eligible NSW businesses with compressed air system upgrade incentives.

You should contact an approved supplier well before you begin an upgrade project. The supplier will explain the process and assist with the incentive.

You may need to measure your compressed air system’s energy use for some time before and after the upgrade. This can be done by sub-metering or checking your energy bills.

Eligibility

To be eligible for assistance, your business must:

  • be located in NSW
  • use an approved supplier.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Energy Savings Scheme

Container deposit refund scheme - ACT

Program:

ACT Container Deposit Scheme

Location:

ACT

The Container Deposit Scheme enables Canberrans to take eligible beverage containers to return points and receive a 10 cent refund for each container. You can choose to keep your refund or donate it to charity.

There are many convenient container return sites across Canberra.

Benefits

Participants can:

  • reduce waste going to landfill 
  • reduce energy use and greenhouse gas emissions when the containers are recycled into products
  • reduce litter
  • donate money to charity or keep the refund.

Eligibility

Eligible containers include most glass, PET, HDPE, aluminium, steel or liquid paperboard (cartons) between 150mL and 3L in size. All containers that can be recognised as an eligible container will be accepted.

Other conditions may apply.

    Contact

    Administered by: ACT Government

    Website: ACT Container Deposit Scheme

    Phone: (02) 6280 8538

Container deposit refund scheme - NT

Program:

Container Deposit Scheme

Location:

NT

The Container Deposit Scheme enables people in the Northern Territory to take eligible beverage containers to return points and receive a 10 cent refund for each container. You can choose to keep your refund or donate it to charity.

There are many convenient container return sites across the Northern Territory.

Benefits

Participants can:

  • reduce litter and waste going to landfill 
  • reduce energy use
  • reduce greenhouse gas emissions
  • donate money to charity or keep the refund.

Eligibility

All approved containers will have one of the following approved 10 cent refund markings on the label:

  • 10 cent refund at collection depots/points
  • 10 cent refund at South Australia and Northern Territory collection depots
  • 10 cent refund at collection depots when sold in the Northern Territory.

Other conditions may apply.

    Contact

    Administered by: Northern Territory Environment Protection Authority

    Website: Container Deposit Scheme

    Email: ntepa@nt.gov.au

    Phone: (08) 8924 4218

energy-theme-green

  1. Home

  3. Container deposit refund scheme - SA

Container deposit refund scheme - SA

Program:

Container Deposit Scheme

Location:

SA

The Container Deposit Scheme enables South Australians to take eligible beverage containers to return points and receive a 10 cent refund for each container. You can choose to keep your refund or donate it to charity.

There are many convenient container return sites across South Australia.

Benefits

Participants can:

  • reduce waste going to landfill 
  • reduce energy use and greenhouse gas emissions when the containers are recycled into products
  • reduce litter
  • donate money to charity or keep the refund.

Eligibility

Beverages containers of less than 1L that have a 10 cent deposit are:

  • flavoured milk
  • fruit juice.

Beverage containers up to and including 3L that have a 10 cent deposit are:

  • water - plain, still or carbonated
  • carbonated soft drinks
  • non-carbonated soft drinks including:
    • vitamin drinks
    • sport drinks
    • iced teas
  • alcoholic cider
  • beers/ales/stouts.
  • flavoured alcoholic beverages with a wine or spirit base

It is illegal to return beverage containers sold outside of South Australia for a refund.

Other conditions may apply.

    Contact

    Administered by: Government of South Australia

    Website: Container Deposit Scheme

Controlled load electricity concession

Program:

Controlled load electricity concession

Location:

Vic

Eligible concession card holders living in Victoria can apply for a 13% concession on controlled load usage charges on domestic mains electricity.

Controlled load charges apply to separately metered electric hot water or slab heating, which is measured via a dual element electricity meter or dual element smart meter. These tariffs are usually shown as 'controlled load' or 'dedicated circuit' tariffs.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the concession, the electricity account holder must have one of the following cards:

  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • Health Care Card
  • Veterans’ Affairs Gold Card.

The concession is only available to households with an eligible dual element electricity meter or dual element smart meter.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by:  Victorian Government

Website: Controlled load electricity concession

Email: concessions@health.vic.gov.au

Phone: 1800 658 521

Discounted energy-efficient lighting for households

Program:

Energy Savings Scheme

Location:

NSW

The Energy efficient lighting offer makes it easier for households in NSW to reduce their energy use by replacing old inefficient halogen lights with energy-efficient light emitting diode (LED) lights. The cost of purchasing the LED bulbs and having them installed by a professional is subsidised.

Benefits

Participants can:

  • reduce maintenance as LEDs last longer
  • reduce electricity use and bills
  • reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the program, your home must:

  • be located in NSW
  • have halogen downlights.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Energy Savings Scheme

Efficient recycling and waste management

Program:

Business Recycling Program

Location:

ACT
NSW

The Actsmart Business Recycling Program is a free program that helps Canberra, Queanbeyan, Bungendore, Braidwood and Captains Flat businesses implement efficient recycling and waste management practices.

Benefits

Program participants can:

  • reduce costs—recycling waste can be as much as 50% cheaper than tipping at landfill
  • reduce impacts on the environment
  • receive public recognition of policies and actions through annual accreditation
  • meet corporate environmental commitments.

Eligibility

To be eligible your business must be located in the locations noted above.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: ACT Government

Website: Business Recycling Program

Email: BusinessRecycling@act.gov.au

  1. Home

  3. Electricity and gas rebates for concession card holders

Electricity and gas rebates for concession card holders

Program:

Electricity Rebate and Reticulated Natural Gas Rebate

Location:

Qld

Queensland concession card holders including pensioners, seniors and veterans may be eligible for an electricity rebate and reticulated natural gas rebate to reduce their energy bills:

The electricity rebate was first introduced to support pensioners, seniors, and veterans, and was extended to Health Care Card holders and asylum seekers in January 2017. Now, the rebate is provided to a range of people who need it most including Low Income Health Care Card holders.

Eligibility

Rebates are available to people who have any of the below:

  • Queensland Seniors Card
  • Services Australia Pensioner Concession Card
  • Services Australia Health Care Card* (Electricity Rebate only)
  • Department of Veterans’ Affairs Gold Card (and receive the War Widow/er Pension or special rate TPI Pension)
  • Asylum seeker status—residents will need to provide their ImmiCard details (Electricity Rebate only).

* This includes holders of a Low Income Health Care Card and Ex-Carer Allowance (Child) Health Care Card.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

To apply for the electricity and gas rebates, contact your electricity or gas retailer.

If you live in an apartment complex, residential park, retirement village or a granny flat, contact the person/organisation sending your electricity bill.

Administered by: Queensland Government

Website: Electricity Rebate and Reticulated Natural Gas Rebate

Phone: 13 QGOV (13 74 68)

Electricity concession for NT Concession Scheme members

Program:

NT Concession Scheme

Location:

NT

Members of the Northern Territory (NT) Concession Scheme can receive a concession on electricity costs.

Members of the scheme can get a maximum concession of $1,200 per household per financial year. Only 1 member per household can get a concession.

Households can reach the cap in a single bill if usage is extremely high, however for most people the concession is spread across multiple bills.

Eligibility 

Jacana Energy and Power and Water Corporation customers will be eligible to apply for the electricity concession if they are:

  • a member of the NT Concession Scheme
  • the primary account holder or financially responsible for the account.

Members using pre-paid electricity meters can get a concession if they are the owner or primary tenant and pre-pay their electricity using one of the following:

  • tokens
  • e-meter
  • secure meter.

Members living in a registered caravan park can get an electricity concession if they:

  • receive an electricity bill
  • purchase private electricity tokens.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Northern Territory Government

Website: NT Concession Scheme

Phone: 1800 777 704

Electricity credit for householders, Western Australia

Program:

Electricity credit for Western Australians

Location:

WA

Eligibility

Eligible cards and payments for existing rebates in Western Australia are:

  • Commonwealth Seniors Health Card
  • Health Care Cards (including Low Income Health Care Card)
  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • DVA Gold Cards.

If you hold one of these cards you are eligible for the existing WA Electricity concession scheme.  

Newly eligible cards and payments for bill relief in Western Australia are:

  • Carer Allowance
  • Family Tax Benefit.

If you receive one of these payments you will be contacted by DVA in July 2023 or Services Australia in September 2023 to tell you what you need to do.

Administered by: Government of Western Australia

Electricity credit for Western Australians

WA

Eligibility

To be eligible, your business must be on a separately metered business tariff with your electricity retailer, and your business’s annual electricity consumption must be less than Western Australia's threshold of 50MWh.

Electricity feed-in tariff

Program:

Energy Made Easy

Location:

ACT
NSW
Qld
SA
Tas

Feed-in tariffs for renewable energy pay for excess electricity generated by small-scale solar photovoltaic (PV) or wind power systems. The amount paid varies between different retailers and can be compared using the Energy Made Easy website.

Eligibility

To receive a feed-in tariff a solar PV system must be:

  • installed on a household or small-businesses
  • connected to the grid within the National Energy Market (NEM).

Financial assistance to help with the cost of installing a small-scale solar system under the Australian Government’s Small-scale Renewable Energy Scheme (SRES) may also be available.

Feed-in credits or payments you receive may have implications if you receive any Centrelink or other benefit payments, they may also be considered as assessable income by the Australian Taxation Office.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Website: Energy Made Easy

Rebates and assistance

energy-theme-green

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Electricity feed-in tariff - WA

Electricity feed-in tariff - WA

Program:

Distributed Energy Buyback Scheme

Location:

WA

The Distributed Energy Buyback Scheme offers eligible customers a time of export payment for electricity they export to the grid, including from rooftop solar PV systems, batteries and electric vehicles.

The DEBS pricing structure encourages households to either use or store their solar energy generation in the middle of the day when it is plentiful and to install west facing panels that will generate electricity later in the day - that is, producing more renewable energy later in the day when electricity demand is typically higher. 

Eligibility

To be eligible you must be:

  • a residential customer who consumes not more than 50 MWh of electricity per annum
  • a customer that is a school, university or other educational institution
  • a customer that is a non-profit-making organisation.

For a renewable energy system to be eligible, it must have a generating capacity of between 500 W and 5kW. A 6.6 kW solar PV system with 5 kVa inverter is accepted as having a generating capacity of 5 kW.

There is no eligibility limit on home battery or electric vehicle battery size, but retailers are only obligated to offer buyback payment for 50 units (kWh) per day per premises (which is more than a 5 kW solar PV system would be expected to generate on any given day).

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Government of Western Australia

Website: Distributed Energy Buyback Scheme

  3. Electricity smart meter upgrade

Electricity smart meter upgrade

Program:

Upgrade my meter

Location:

ACT

The ActewAGL Upgrade my meter scheme gives ACT households access to detailed information online about their electricity usage.

With an electricity smart meter you can make more informed choices about how and when you use electricity, including opportunities to reduce your electricity bill. Your new meter sends usage data back to your ActewAGL account, which you can see any time by logging on to your account.

Once your new meter is installed you may be placed on a new pricing plan. This means your charges may be different.

Benefits

Participants can:

  • switch to new electricity pricing to change the way you’re billed
  • reduce energy use and energy bills
  • improve energy efficiency
  • reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

Eligibility

To be eligible you must:

  • be an ActewAGL account holder
  • live in a residential property in the ACT.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: ActewAGL

Website: Upgrade my meter

Email: MeterInstallations@actewagl.com.au

Phone: 1300 815 815

Energy assessments and rebates on implementation for small business

Program:

Free energy assessments for small business

Location:

SA

Note

The available places for this pilot program have been filled and they will not be taking further applications. You can register your interest by emailing incentives@cityofadelaide.com.au and you will be contacted if another round opens in the future.

To explore other available rebates visit the Sustainability Incentive Scheme page.

Overview

The City of Adelaide offered free energy assessments to 50 small businesses in the accommodation, food services and retail sectors to assist with reducing energy costs.

The free technical energy assessments identified energy-saving opportunities and estimate potential electricity and gas bills savings.

Businesses were then eligible for 80% rebate, up to a maximum of $5,000, to cover the implementation of the energy saving opportunities outlined in the energy assessment report.

energy-theme-green

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Energy bill concession

Energy bill concession

Program:

Energy bill concessions

Location:

SA

Eligible South Australians on low or fixed incomes can apply for help with the cost of energy bills for their principal place of residence.

The concession amount is indexed each financial year.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the energy concession you must:

  • live at the property
  • have an energy account in your name and be listed first on your energy bill
  • hold an eligible concession card or receive an eligible Centrelink payment
  • not be living with anyone who has an income of more than $3,000 per year, unless they either:
    • get an allowance from Centrelink or the Department of Veterans' Affairs (DVA)
    • are your spouse, domestic partner or dependent.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Government of South Australia

Website: Energy bill concessions

Email: concessions@sa.gov.au

Phone: 1800 307 758

Energy bill relief and energy efficiency assistance

Program:

Your Energy Support

Location:

Tas

Aurora Energy's Your Energy Support program provides eligible Tasmanian residential customers, experiencing financial difficulties, with the tools to take control of energy usage and bills.

The program provides simple energy saving tips, energy efficiency advice and free (mandatory) phone energy audits to help understand your energy consumption and ways to reduce your energy bills. It also includes tailored, flexible payment plans for immediate and longer-term relief.

Eligibility

To be eligible you must:

  • have been identiﬁed as being in ﬁnancial difficulty
  • have an active residential connection with Aurora Energy with it being your principal place of residence
  • have an amount outstanding on your energy account
  • show a willingness to make contributions to your energy account
  • actively participate in energy audits, seeking assistance from welfare organisations and make an effort to reduce energy use.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Aurora Energy

Website: Your Energy Support

Phone: 1300 10 2010

Energy bill relief for households, ACT

Program:

Energy bill relief for households, ACT

Location:

ACT

Eligibility

Eligible cards and payments for existing rebates in ACT are:

  • ACT Services Access Card
  • Low Income Health Care Card
  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • PoW, TPI, and War Widow DVA Gold Cards.

If you hold one of these cards you are eligible for the existing ACT Utilities Concession scheme. 

Newly eligible cards and payments for bill relief in ACT are:

  • all other DVA Gold Cards
  • Carer Allowance
  • Commonwealth Seniors Health Card
  • Family Tax Benefit
  • Health Care Card.

If you hold or receive one of these cards or payments you will be contacted by DVA in July or by Services Australia in September to tell you what you need to do.

Administered by: ACT Government

(02) 6207 0028

Program:

Energy bill relief for households, NSW

NSW

Eligibility

Eligible cards and payments for existing rebates in NSW are:

  • Commonwealth Seniors Health Card
  • Family Tax Benefit
  • Health Care Card
  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • Recipients of Life Support Rebate
  • Department of Veterans' Affairs (DVA) Gold Cards marked with either ‘War Widow’ or ‘War Widower Pension’ or ‘Totally and Permanently Incapacitated’ (TPI) or ‘Disability Pension’ (EDA).

Newly eligible cards and payments for bill relief in NSW are:

  • all other DVA Gold Cards

  • Low Income Health Care Card.

If you hold or receive one of these cards or payments you will be contacted by DVA in July 2023 or Services Australia in September 2023 to tell you what you need to do.

Administered by: NSW Government

  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • Special Benefit
  • TPI, EDA, War Widow and 80 OIP DVA Gold Cards
  • War widow pension under legislation of the United Kingdom or New Zealand
  • Widow Allowance
  • Youth Allowance.

If you hold one of these cards you are eligible for the existing SA Electricity concession scheme.  

Newly eligible cards and payments for bill relief in South Australia are:

  • all other DVA Gold Cards
  • Carer Allowance
  • Family Tax Benefit
  • Health Care Cards.

If you receive one of these payments you will be contacted by DVA in July 2023 or Services Australia in September 2023 to tell you what you need to do.

Administered by: Government of South Australia

Phone:  1800 307 758

Energy bill relief for households, Victoria

Program:

Energy bill relief for households, Victoria

Location:

Vic

Eligible residents in Victoria can get $250 per household, plus a one off $250 direct payment through Victoria’s 2023 Power Saving Bonus Payment. 

Eligibility

Eligible cards and payments for existing rebates in Victoria are:

  • DVA Gold Cards
  • Health Care Card
  • Low Income Health Care Card
  • Pensioner Concession Card.

If you hold one of these cards you are eligible for the existing Victorian Electricity concession scheme.  

Newly eligible cards and payments for bill relief in Victoria are:

  • Carer Allowance
  • Commonwealth Seniors Health Card
  • Family Tax Benefit.

If you hold or receive one of these cards or payments you will be contacted by DVA in July 2023 or Services Australia in September 2023 to tell you what you need to do.

Administered by: Victorian Government

Phone: 13 61 86

Rebates and assistance

energy-theme-green

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Energy bill relief for small businesses, ACT

Energy bill relief for small businesses, ACT

Program:

Energy bill relief for small businesses, ACT

Location:

ACT

Eligibility

To be eligible, your business must be on a separately metered business tariff with your electricity retailer, and your business’s annual electricity consumption must be less than the threshold for your state or territory.

The energy consumption threshold is 100MWh in the ACT.

Your business will benefit from lower electricity charges flowing from the ACT’s Large-scale Feed-in Tariff Scheme. If your business has average electricity use it will receive a reduction in electricity charges of $624. Your business will also receive a $325 rebate.

You don’t need to do anything. If you are eligible, you will receive bill relief on your electricity bills from 1 July 2023.

Administered by the ACT Government.

(02) 6207 0028
